title: Building Phosphorus Research Potential: Developing existing methods and exploring the potential of emerging techniques
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText: We are currently developing our capacity to utilise novel advanced techniques for phosphorus research including 2D-NMR and novel applications of 18O-PO4 stable isotopes techniques. Agriculture, Food and Drink,Environment Societal
findingsText: We are in the process of developing our capacity for using advanced techniques for the analysis of phosphorus to help us better understand phosphorus cycling in soils, plants and waters. We are also developing new ideas for how these methods can be used to further enhance our knowledge on phosphorus cycling. Additionally, we are developing a review paper on the fundamentals of phosphorus chemistry in soils. We are also carrying out some collaborative research between the Institutes involved in this Partnering Award involving the sharing of samples and analysis techniques. Others may be able to adopt the methods we are developing, and some of our research will hopefully mean we have a better understanding of phosphorus cycling which will inform its better and more sustainable use in agriculture in the future.
